html:
vain oblations. The sacrifices and offerings of the Israelites were presented to the Lord without the proper attitude or spirit. Vain means "empty."

incense. Incense, which here refers to the incense offering placed on the altar of incense (Ex. 30:1, 7-8, 34-36), was burned twice daily in the sanctuary. The smoke from these offerings rose to the heavens, symbolizing the prayers of Israel rising to God (Ps. 141:2; Rev. 5:8).

abomination. The offerings of Israel were an abomination because the people were wicked, despite their religious observances.
